questions.question_text: Channel bonding will improve which of the following wireless characteristics?

choices.B: Link from router A to server A is down
choices.C: Link from PC 1 to router A has duplex issues
choices.A: Link from touter A to PC 1 are on different subnets
choices.D: Link from server A top PC 2 is down

questions.question_text:
A user is unable to connect to a server in another building. A technician is troubleshooting the issue and determines the following:
1) Client PC 1 has an IP address if 192.168.10.25/25
2) PC 1 can successfully ping its gateway of 192.168.10.1/25 which is an interface of router A
3) Server A is named 'BLDGBFILESRVR01' and has an IP address of 192.168.10.145/25
4) PC 2 with an IP address of 192.168.10.200/25 can successfully ping server A
However, when PC 1 pings server A, it receives a destination host unreachable responds. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

discussion.content: NOT A!! It plainly says that PC1 can ping IT'S GATEWAY, which is Router A....answer is B....if ya dont understand this, you will fail

Bottom line: 

With this particular case of hiring new employees various filters should be in place in order to iron-out any potential risk to the company. As an example (or for starters) the onus lies with management responsible for hiring to have a robust vetting system in place, which would already weed out (or put extra restrictions on) interviewees for the job vacancies that garner more questions than answers.

Such filters should eventually cascade to the network administrator who can implement the appropriate operational and technical controls set for the new hires BEFORE even having access to their terminals. 

Granted that the topic discussed here is by far more granular in its complexity, but with every level of the hire process lending their weight on implementing a set of tried and tested policies, implementation could eventually be streamlined - with periodic policy reviews in place - as we all know that an organisation seen from any angle (being the people that make the company to the underlying IT that allows the ultimate workings) is never static...

Security Controls

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Information_Security_Basics/Security_Controls

choices.C: Provide end user awareness and training for employees
choices.D: Ensure best practices were implemented when creating new user accounts
choices.A: Create VLANs to segment the network traffic
choices.B: Place a network sniffer on segments with new employees

questions.question_text:
A company has added several new employees, which has caused the network traffic to increase by 200%. The network traffic increase from the new employees was only expected to be 20% to 30%. The administration suspects that the network may have been compromised.
Which of the following should the network administrator have done previously to minimize the possibility of a network breach?

choices.D: Establish a theory of probable cause
choices.A: Test a theory to determine the cause

discussion.content:
D is correct,

1.
Identify the problem.
2.
Establish a theory of probable cause.
3.
Test the theory to determine the cause.
4.
Establish a plan of action to resolve the problem and identify potential effects.
5.
Implement the solution or escalate as necessary.
6.
Verify full system functionality and, if applicable, implement preventative measures.
7.
Document findings, actions, and outcomes.

questions.question_text:
A network technician discovers an issue with spanning tree on the core switch.
Which of the following troubleshooting steps should the network technician perform NEXT to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Ans: LACP : Link Aggregation Control Protocol is an IEEE standard defined in IEEE 802.3ad. LACP lets devices send Link Aggregation Control Protocol Data Units (LACPDUs) to each other to establish a link aggregation connection. ... Both devices must support LACP for you to set up a dynamic LAG between those devices

In computer networking, the term link aggregation refers to various methods of combining multiple network connections in parallel in order to increase throughput beyond what a single connection could sustain, and to provide redundancy in case one of the links should fail.

NIC need to be combined for maximum throughput.
Which of the following features on the switch should the network administrator use?
